revised_title: Phenomena Resulting from Interruption of Afferent and Efferent Tracts of the Cerebellum
tldr: The author investigates the effects of dividing the inferior cerebellar peduncle on one side and compares the results with control experiments involving partial section of the lateral region of the medulla and transverse section of the posterior columns and their nuclei. The study aims to determine the direct influence of the cerebellum on spinal centers and provide evidence for or against the idea that the cerebellum exerts a direct influence on spinal centers through descending tracts.
